org.openpoi.server.api
Interface PoiManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
HibernateSpatialPoiManager, MemoryBasedPoiManager
public interface PoiManager

Responsible for handling POI queries within one or more layers. OpenPoi is configured to use a class implementing PoiManager per layer, and PoiManager's will then be instantiated to respond to queries.

PoiManager instances are intended to be short-lived, i.e. creation time should be quick, and the implementation should not rely on a state per-instance, since new instances will likely be created for new queries.

Author:
Per Liedman (per@liedman.net)

Method Summary
 void beginTransaction()
          Tells the PoiManager that one or more queries will be made to this instance.
 void commit()
          Informs the PoiManager that the current transaction completed successfully and should be committed.
 Collection<?> getPoisWithinGeometry(Query query)
          Returns the POIs that match the query specified by the arguments.
 void rollback()
          Informs the PoiManager that the current transaction failed and should be rolled back.
 

Method Detail

getPoisWithinGeometry

Collection<?> getPoisWithinGeometry(Query query)

Returns the POIs that match the query specified by the arguments.

The implementation can safely assume that the instance's beginTransaction method has been called before this method is called.

Parameters:
layerName - the text name of the layer being queried
zoomLevel - the zoom level being queried
within - the geometry which the returned geometries should be within
categoryIds - the IDs of the categories being queried
Returns:
the POI objects that match the query

beginTransaction

void beginTransaction()
Tells the PoiManager that one or more queries will be made to this instance. This method is always called before a query is made, and a call to this method will be matched by a call to commit or rollback.

commit

void commit()
Informs the PoiManager that the current transaction completed successfully and should be committed.

rollback

void rollback()
Informs the PoiManager that the current transaction failed and should be rolled back.
